main event: A ground radar operator at Keesler AFB, Mississippi, detected an unidentified target on the radar scope that was tracked for about 3 minutes before disappearing, likely having gained altitude and gone off the radar.
interesting points: The radar target was detected at 0226Z.
The radar operator tracked the unidentified target for about 3 minutes before it disappeared from the scope.
It is possible the target gained altitude and went off the radar.

There was a separate sighting of a bright, steady white object by a tower operator at Keesler AFB on December 7, 1969. The object was round-shaped, approximately 30 feet in diameter, and traveled in a northwesterly direction.

On December 6, 1960, a patrol at Keesler AFB sighted a bright amber, orange, and red object in the sky that changed direction from the northeast to the southeast and was observed for approximately 10 minutes.
sighted object: unidentified radar target, round-shaped bright white object, bright amber/orange/red object
witnesses: ground radar operator, tower operator, patrol
